poem:
**Joint Ventures**

Between the tectonic whispers and sea's embrace,  
Hazel charted pathways of shared potential.  
Stories of oil beneath the waves, a handshake's grace,  
Crafting peace where ambition might wrestle.  
Academic tides and bilateral trails,  
She mapped futures when trust set sail.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Letter: Hazel Fox obituary As a master’s degree student at Hull University in the late 1980s I was looking for a suitable dissertation topic. My supervisor, David Freestone, told me of a conference that Hazel Fox was organising at the British Institute of International & Comparative Law (BIICL), on the then little-known concept of joint development as applied to mainly bilateral co-operative agreements between states extracting offshore oil and gas from common deposits on a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
